title: Licensing of Unicode-related functionality?

labels.name: T-core
labels.description: Relevant to the core team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-meta
labels.description: Area: Issues about the rust-lang/rust repository.

body:
In the course of reviewing licenses for Fuchsia's external dependencies, we've noticed that some crates in the ecosystem, [including std](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/tools/unicode-table-generator/src/unicode_download.rs), make use of [Unicode data files](https://www.unicode.org/Public/UCD/latest/ucd), but don't seem to treat the code generated from those data files as bound by the [Unicode license](https://www.unicode.org/license.txt). Unicode has a [licensing FAQ](https://www.unicode.org/faq/unicode_license.html) but I'm not sure how normative that is.

IANAL, so I'm not sure whether the Unicode license should apply to the [files in core](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/library/core/src/unicode/unicode_data.rs#L1) which seem to be generated from the Unicode data files, but I wanted to raise the possibility for the project to consider.
